work.name: Wyle
work.summary: Supporting research and development projects on-site at the Air Force Research Labatory (AFRL) in the Sensors Directorate at Wright Patterson AFB, OH
highlights: Part of a 10+ member team working on a Imagery Survailence Reconisence (ISR) viewer
Lead developer on major updates for the product

work.name: Jacobs Tech
work.summary: Supported the United States Air Force C-130 AMP (ASC/WLNM) system program office (SPO) by providing software and system architecture expertise as it relates to tactical data links radios.
highlights: Support the C-130 AMP program office in acquistion activities
Helped created the capabilities requirements based document (CBD) for the integration of network centric radio onto the C-130H platform
Interfaced the government personal regarding requirements and technical aspects of the program
Evaluate information sources to develop a higher level of knowledge and understanding of the JTRS system being evaluated

work.name: L-3 Nova Engineering
work.summary: Collaborated and developed C and C++ embedded projects within a large and small software team for Defense programs
highlights: Created system design and implemented multi-threaded C++ software on a GPP running embedded linux
Lead system intregration into the overall system
Engineered new applications, drivers, and messaging systems, and ported code to new hardware
Made efficiency improvements for embedded platforms

work.name: Applied Innovations
work.summary: Provided tech support for specific telecommunications products focusing on network management for cell technology.
highlights: Designed and implemented a web user interface for the 'Polled Mediation' product to allow customers to remotely configure and display logs
